items.q: The job requirements do not specify whether or not you need a college degree. ____________________
Their primary reason for taking the Spanish class was to prepare for their summer vacation in Mexico. ____________________
Since Henry doesn’t have a car, he relies on public transportation to get to and from work. ____________________
Gloria had to resist the urge to make corrections during her co-worker’s presentation. ____________________
The students didn’t follow the instructions carefully, which certainly affected the outcome of the experiment. ____________________
Although the leather shoes felt tight when I tried them on, the salesperson assured me that they would stretch over time. ____________________
With your positive attitude, you will be able to accomplish anything you set your mind to. ____________________
Albert dreaded going to work the next day when he knew that a number of people would be laid off. ____________________
Nora was puzzled that the lights were on when she returned home. She was sure she had turned them off before leaving. ____________________
It was crucial for the players to work together as a team if they were going to win the tournament. ____________________
over a(n) _____ of time
blend _____ with the trees
accomplish a(n) _____
save precious _____
gain _____ to
the advent of _____
_____ people’s lives easier
express my _____
a(n) _____ of materials
a(n) _____ illusion
While New Year’s Day celebrations may be observed in different ways, they are common to many cultures around the world. a. topic b. thesis statement
Moving away from our dependency on oil. a. topic b. thesis statement
How to make our food safer to eat. a. topic b. thesis statement
When parents divorce, it can have a deep and lasting impact on a child’s life. a. topic b. thesis statement
Voting is critically important to the effective and honest maintenance of democracy. a. topic b. thesis statement

In addition, computers allow musicians to market and sell their own music. Musicians can record and create their own CDs at a relatively modest cost these days. Before the development of the personal computer, most musicians could not afford to record their own music, but now the costs are much more reasonable. For this reason, it makes less sense for musicians to give away a part of their profits to a record company for activities that they can accomplish themselves. a. This is the first body paragraph in the essay. b. This is the second body paragraph in the essay. c. This is the third body paragraph in the essay.

Because of the popularity of sharing computer sound files, consumers no longer feel that they need to purchase music. Many people think it is morally acceptable—not to mention convenient—to download music files for free via file-sharing services. A couple clicks and presto! Now you “own” on your own computer that catchy little tune that you have been humming. Then it is just a couple more clicks until it is burned on a CD for you. With this level of convenience, it is easy to see why record companies are feeling the pinch. a. This is the first body paragraph in the essay. b. This is the second body paragraph in the essay. c. This is the third body paragraph in the essay.

Furthermore, the recording industry bears some of the blame for its own problems simply because it has been recalcitrant about using personal computers to sell its products. It has long annoyed me that record companies primarily sell whole albums when only one of the songs is of interest to me. I do not like to waste my money on an entire album and then find out that the album has just one good song on it. The recording industry should package and sell music in a way that consumers want and take advantage of personal computers to market songs to individual consumers. a. This is the first body paragraph in the essay. b. This is the second body paragraph in the essay. c. This is the third body paragraph in the essay.

The thesis statement in the first paragraph is: a. The recording industry is in a slump. b. What has caused this downward spiral for the music industry? c. There are three reasons that the computer has had a deleterious effect on the recording industry.

The concluding statement “The computer has brought about tremendous changes to the recording industry, and the industry will have to move quickly to retain its relevance in today’s economy.” offers ____. a. a suggestion b. an option c. a prediction
What kind of essay is this an example of? a. process b. comparison c. cause-effect
In addition __________
After that __________
On the other hand __________
As a result of __________
I think I did a mistake on the essay portion of the exam. __________
Nick trained for the marathon over the time of a year . __________
Computers are supposed to cause people's lives easier . __________
His explanation for being late didn’t make sense to me. __________
Due to a lack of interest, the elective course on the history of music has been cancelled. __________

Consider your opinion about the use of cell phones in schools. Should students’ use of cell phones in schools be prohibited? Consider good essay organization, including an introduction with a thesis statement, a body, and a conclusion.
